articles.headline: In Atlanta, Fear of Violent Crime Creates Opportunity for a Polarizing Politician
articles.snippet: Kasim Reed, the former mayor whose administration was marked by corruption scandals, is running for another term, promising to restore public safety.
articles.abstract: Kasim Reed, the former mayor whose administration was marked by corruption scandals, is running for another term, promising to restore public safety.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA — The fear of rising crime in American cities is having a profound effect on mayoral politics from New York to Seattle. In Atlanta, it has had the power of resurrection, delivering a reanimating jolt to the once-moribund career of one of the South’s most polarizing public figures.

articles.headline: Military Officials Say They Urged Biden Against Afghanistan Withdrawal
articles.snippet: During a heated Senate hearing, Gen. Mark Milley also defended his actions in the final months of the Trump administration.
articles.abstract: During a heated Senate hearing, Gen. Mark Milley also defended his actions in the final months of the Trump administration.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Pentagon leaders publicly acknowledged on Tuesday that they advised President Biden not to withdraw all troops from Afghanistan ahead of a chaotic evacuation in which 13 U.S. service members died in a suicide bombing and 10 Afghan civilians were killed in an American drone strike.
articles.byline: By Helene Cooper and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: Retailers’ Latest Headache: Shutdowns at Their Vietnamese Suppliers
articles.snippet: Factories in the country, a major apparel and footwear supplier to the U.S., have been forced by the pandemic to close or operate at reduced capacity, complicating the all-important holiday season.
articles.abstract: Factories in the country, a major apparel and footwear supplier to the U.S., have been forced by the pandemic to close or operate at reduced capacity, complicating the all-important holiday season.
articles.lead_paragraph: After a bruising 18 months of the pandemic, this fall represented a fresh start for the apparel company Everlane. It was preparing to release a slew of new products, with September marking the beginning of an ambitious marketing campaign around its denim.
articles.byline: By Sapna Maheshwari and Patricia Cohen

articles.headline: YouTube bans all anti-vaccine misinformation.
articles.snippet: The new set of policies will cover not just the Covid-19 vaccines or long-approved vaccines against diseases like measles and hepatitis B, but also general claims about vaccines, YouTube said.
articles.abstract: The new set of policies will cover not just the Covid-19 vaccines or long-approved vaccines against diseases like measles and hepatitis B, but also general claims about vaccines, YouTube said.
articles.lead_paragraph: YouTube said on Wednesday that it was banning the accounts of several prominent anti-vaccine activists from its platform, including those of Joseph Mercola and Robert F. Kennedy Jr., as part of an effort to remove all content that falsely claims that approved vaccines are dangerous.

articles.headline: At Ozy Media, a Star Journalist Quits, and a Key Investor Backs Away
articles.snippet: Katty Kay, who had left the BBC for Ozy, resigned, and the A&E cable network canceled the broadcast of a documentary it had co-produced with the company.
articles.abstract: Katty Kay, who had left the BBC for Ozy, resigned, and the A&E cable network canceled the broadcast of a documentary it had co-produced with the company.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ozy Media was facing pressure on multiple fronts days after The New York Times reported that a co-founder had apparently impersonated a YouTube executive during a conference call with Goldman Sachs in February.
articles.byline: By Katie Robertson and Ben Smith
